TopicSection.Name: BodyText
TopicSection.Content:
Spread.Views supports filtering item for each data field. You can write an expression string and use it as the condition for filtering in Spread.Views, for example "filter('[quantity] >= 100')" or "filter('[quantity] >= AVERAGE([quantity]')".

You can set the filter in the following ways:

  • By setting the filter option

    Sample Code

    Javascript JS var gcGrid = new GcSpread.Grid.GcGrid(document.getElementById('grid1'), data, columns,
    { filter: expression });
  • By calling the filter method

    Sample Code

    Javascript JS var gcGrid = new GcSpread.Grid.GcGrid(document.getElementById('grid1'), data, columns);
    gcGrid.data.filter(expression).do();

Spread.Views also supports to write a filter with chaining statements such as

Sample Code

Javascript JS gcGrid.data.filter(expression1).and(expression2).or(expression3).do();
